intro: Acronia correllii, commonly known as the Florida acronia, is a rare flowering plant native to the coastal dunes of Florida. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has a compact growth habit and thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. It is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate periodic flooding, making it unique to its specific habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
